{{Infobox book | name = Getting to YES | image = Getting to Yes.jpg | image_size = | caption = | author = [[Roger Fisher (academic)|Roger Fisher]] and [[William Ury|William L. Ury]]; and Bruce Patton in some editions | genre = Non-fiction | publisher = [[Penguin Group]] | country = United Kingdom | language = English | pub_date = 1981 (2nd ed. 1991, 3rd ed. 2011) | pages = 200 pp. | media_type = Print, e-book | isbn = 9780395317570 | dewey= 158/.5 20 | congress= BF637.N4 F57 | oclc= 7575986 | followed_by = [[Getting Past NO]] }}
'''''Getting to Yes: Negotiating Agreement Without Giving In''''' is a best-selling 1981 non-fiction book by [[Roger Fisher (academic)|Roger Fisher]] and [[William Ury|William L. Ury]]. Subsequent editions in 1991 and 2011 added Bruce Patton as co-author. All of the authors were members of the [[Harvard Negotiation Project]]. The book made appearances for years on the ''[[Business Week]]'' [[bestseller]] list. The book suggests a method called '''principled negotiation''' or "[[negotiation]] of merits".
==Background== Members of the [[Harvard Negotiation Project]], Fisher and Ury focused on the psychology of negotiation in their method, "principled negotiation", finding acceptable solutions by determining which needs are fixed and which are flexible for negotiators.<ref>{{cite journal | title = The Dance of Negotiation | last = Morrow | first = Lance | date = Dec 7, 1981 | url = http://www.time.com/time/magazine/article/0,9171,953270-1,00.html | journal = Time | accessdate = 2009-08-06}}</ref> By 1987, the book had been adopted in several U.S. school districts to help students understand "non-adversarial bargaining".<ref>{{cite news | title = Alternatives To adversarial negotiations being used successfully | work = Eugene Register-Guard | date = May 12, 1987 | last = Piele | first = Philip K. |author2=Stuart C. Smith | url = https://news.google.com/newspapers?id=_sQUAAAAIBAJ&sjid=fuEDAAAAIBAJ&pg=4151,3089660&dq=getting-to-yes+fisher | accessdate = 2009-08-06}}</ref> In 1991, the book was issued in a second edition with Bruce Patton, an editor of the first edition, listed as a co-author. The book became a perennial best-seller. By July 1998, it had been appearing for more than three years on the ''Business Week'' "Best-Seller" book list.<ref>{{cite news |title=The Business Week Best-Seller List |work=Business Week |date=July 6, 1998 |url=http://www.businessweek.com/1998/27/b3585036.htm |accessdate=2009-08-06 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090215040748/http://www.businessweek.com/1998/27/b3585036.htm |archivedate=2009-02-15 |df= }}</ref> As of December 2007, it was still making appearances on the list as one of the "Longest Running Best Sellers" in paperback business books.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.businessweek.com/magazine/content/07_49/b4061103.htm |title=The Business Week Best Seller List |work=Business Week |date=December 3, 2007 |accessdate=2009-08-06 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20081003024129/http://www.businessweek.com/magazine/content/07_49/b4061103.htm |archivedate=October 3, 2008 }}</ref> The third edition was published in 2011.<ref name="3rd ed"/>
==Method of principled negotiation== {{Page numbers needed|section|date=May 2017}} The method of principled negotiation was developed at the Harvard [[Program on Negotiation]] by Fisher, Ury, and Patton.<ref>{{cite web |title = About the Harvard Negotiation Project | work = Program on Negotiation Harvard Law School | date = April 19, 2009 | url = http://www.pon.harvard.edu/research_projects/harvard-negotiation-project/hnp/ | accessdate = January 4, 2014}}</ref> Its purpose is to reach agreement without jeopardizing business relations.<ref>{{cite journal |title = The Harvard Principled Negotiation | work = The World of Collaborative Practice | last = Gladel | first = Florence | date = July 1, 2012 | url = http://theworldofcollaborativepractice.com/?p=1305 | accessdate = January 4, 2014}}</ref> The method is based on five propositions:<ref name=":0">{{cite book |last1=Fisher |first1=Roger |last2=Ury |first2=William |last3=Patton |first3=Bruce |date=1991 |origyear=1981 |title=Getting to Yes: Negotiating Agreement Without Giving In |edition=2nd |location=New York |publisher=Penguin Books |isbn=9780140157352 |oclc=24318769}}</ref>
=== "Separate the people from the problem" === The first principle of ''Getting to Yes''—"Separate the people from the problem"—applies to the interaction between the two parties to a negotiation. The principle is broken down into three subcategories: perception, emotion, and communication. The authors point out that negotiators are people first—people who have values, cultural backgrounds, and emotions that vary by person.<ref name=":0" /> ''Getting to Yes'' teaches that this human aspect can be either helpful or disastrous. Negotiation can either build trust and understanding with a positive relationship established at the end, or lead to frustration or dissatisfaction. The authors discuss how the relationship between parties tends to become entangled with the problem that the parties are discussing.<ref name=":0" />
Incorrectly deducing the intentions of the other party based on one's own fear is a common mistake; the authors describe it as a bad habit that could cost "fresh ideas in the direction of agreement".<ref name=":0" /> The authors explain that feelings are just as important as the content of the dispute during negotiation. Communication is the main aspect of negotiating, and the authors point out three common problems in communication: # Not clearly speaking with the other party, but instead attempting to impress those within one's constituency by taking a side instead of working toward a mutual agreement; # Not actively listening to the other party, but instead only listening to rebut the other party's statements; # Misunderstanding or misinterpreting what the other party has said.
Similarly, in the book, ''I Win You Win'', Carl Lyons explored the principle of "separating the person from the problem" and discovered that interests are an extension of values. People's current interests are always attempting to satisfy something that they value. Understanding this principle is a key first step in understanding people's behavior in negotiations.<ref>{{Cite book|title=I win, you win: the essential guide to principled negotiation|last=Lyons|first=Carl|publisher=London : A & C Black|year=2007|isbn=|location=9781408101902|pages=29}}</ref>
=== "Focus on interests, not positions" === The second principle—"Focus on interests, not positions"—is about the position that the parties hold and the interests that led them to that position. The authors recommend that negotiators should focus on the interests behind the position that each party holds. Both parties should discuss their interests and keep an open mind to the other side of the argument.<ref name=":0" /> It is crucial to put yourself in the shoes of the other side to try to understand "why" the other side is acting the way they are or rather "why they are not".<ref name="3rd ed">{{cite book |last1=Fisher |first1=Roger |last2=Ury |first2=William |last3=Patton |first3=Bruce |date=2011 |origyear=1981 |title=Getting to Yes: Negotiating Agreement Without Giving In |edition=3rd |location=New York |publisher=Penguin Books |isbn=9780143118756 |oclc=609540048}}</ref>{{rp|46}} The authors state that "the most powerful interests are basic human needs".<ref name="3rd ed"/>{{rp|50}}
=== "Invent options for mutual gain" === The third principle—"Invent options for mutual gain"—is about benefiting both parties that are doing business. This principle aims to help the parties find an option that will impact each party in a positive way, making both sides feel like they did not get taken advantage of during the negotiation. It is important to listen to the other party and not make a decision until both parties feel that they have been heard. Both parties should clearly explain their intentions and what they want out of the conversation.<ref name=":0" />
=== "Insist on using objective criteria" === The fourth principle—"Insist on using objective criteria"—is about making sure that the conversation stays on topic and that it is productive. The parties are making deals based on objective and practical criteria. The three steps to using objective criteria are to find out what the other party's intentions are, keep an open mind, and never give in to pressure or threats.<ref name=":0" /> Each party is in charge of keeping the other party committed to the conversation.
=== "Know your BATNA" === The fifth principle—"Know your [[Best alternative to a negotiated agreement|BATNA]] (Best Alternative To Negotiated Agreement)"—emphasizes that no method can guarantee success if all the leverage lies on the other side.<ref name=":0" /> The authors suggest two methods of going about negotiating from a position of power. First, each party should protect themselves first. Second, each party should make the most of the power within their own assets to negotiate and win against the opposite party.
When negotiating, the parties must resist the urge to constantly compromise for fear of completely losing the negotiation. Such compromises may allow for a shorter negotiation, but may also leave the primary party with a deal that didn't benefit them to the full extent. Establishing a "bottom line" can protect the negotiator's final offer, but may limit the ability to learn from the negotiation itself and may preclude further negotiation that possibly could result in a better advantage for all parties involved. When considering final decisions, each party may want to take a step back and consider all possible alternatives to the current offer being made. One example in the book describes a house on the market: Thinking of all other possibilities if the house were not sold should be compared with the option of selling the house to ensure the best decision is made.<ref name=":0" />
==Principled negotiation in action== The article "Taking steps toward 'Getting to Yes' at Blue Cross and Blue Shield of Florida" highlights principled negotiation in practice by a major insurance company.<ref name="BCBS">{{cite journal |last1=Booth |first1=Bridget |last2=McCredie |first2=Matt |date=August 2004 |title=Taking steps toward "Getting to Yes" at Blue Cross and Blue Shield of Florida |journal=The Academy of Management Executive |volume=18 |issue=3 |pages=109–112 |doi=10.5465/AME.2004.14776178 |url=http://amp.aom.org/content/18/3/109 |publisher=[[Academy of Management]]}}</ref> [[Blue Cross and Blue Shield]]—aware of increasing competition, rising healthcare prices, and increased customer expectations—sought to highlight other parties' interests when creating policies so as not to drive away business.<ref name="BCBS"/> The authors noted that applying principled negotiation techniques came much more naturally at the executive level and needed more practice at lower levels of management.<ref name="BCBS"/>
==Criticism== [[James J. White]], a professor of law at the [[University of Michigan]], suggested that ''Getting to Yes'' is not scholarly or analytical and relies on anecdotal evidence, and that "the authors seem to deny the existence of a significant part of the negotiation process, and to oversimplify or explain away many of the most troublesome problems inherent in the art and practice of negotiation".<ref name="White">{{cite journal |last=White |first=James J. |authorlink=James J. White |date=1984 |title=Review: The Pros and Cons of "Getting to YES": Getting to YES by Roger Fisher, William Ury |journal=Journal of Legal Education |volume=34 |issue=1 |pages=115–124 |url=http://repository.law.umich.edu/reviews/82/ |jstor=42897936}}</ref> There is no quantitative evidence presented that suggests outcomes using this technique will typically be better than an alternative method, such as positional bargaining.<ref name="White"/>
==''Getting Past No''== {{Main article|Getting Past No}} ''[[Getting Past No]]'' is a reference book on collaborative negotiation in difficult situations, written by [[William L. Ury]]. First published in September 1991 and revised in 2007, this book is the sequel to ''Getting to Yes''.

Former owner of [[Illawarra Hawks]] NBL Basketball Team | net_worth = {{gain}} $51 million (2016) | organization = MHOR Asset Management }} '''James Spenceley''' (born September 1976) is an Australian [[investor]], award-winning entrepreneur and company director. He is the founder of Vocus Communications (now Vocus Group), the CEO and co-founder of MHOR asset management and an active Venture Capital investor. He is also the Chairman of [[Airtasker]], Chairman of Silver Heritage Group and Non-Executive Director of Indoor Skydive Australia. Spenceley is most widely known for his role as the founder and former CEO of Australia's 4th largest fixed line telecommunications company [[Vocus Communications]].{{Cite news|url=http://www.smh.com.au/business/markets/vocus-to-merge-with-m2-to-create-3-billion-telecommunications-titan-20150927-gjw4jg.html|title=Vocus to merge with M2 to create $3 billion telecommunications titan|last=Ramli|first=David|date=2015-09-28|work=The Sydney Morning Herald|access-date=2017-11-28|language=en-US}} Spenceley started Vocus in September 2007. He sold his house to initially fund the business.The company listed on the [[Australian Stock Exchange]] (ASX) in 2010.{{Cite news|url=http://www.smh.com.au/business/workplace-relations/meet-the-boss-vocus-founder-james-spenceley-20160217-gmw8i9.html|title=Meet the boss: Vocus founder James Spenceley|last=White|first=Sue|date=2016-02-20|work=The Sydney Morning Herald|access-date=2017-11-29|language=en-US}} When he stepped down as CEO of Vocus in March 2016 the company had revenues of greater than $1.8 billion and a market capitalisation of $5 billion.{{cite web|url=https://www.cmo.com.au/article/608016/cmo50-2016-9-jon-amery-vocus/|title=CMO50 2016 #9: Jon Amery, Vocus|website=CMO Australia|language=en-au|accessdate=22 June 2018}} In 2016 Spenceley was listed at number 51 of [[Financial Review Rich List]] of 100 wealthiest Australian's under 40 with a net worth of $51 million. Spenceley purchased the [[Wollongong Hawks]] (now [[Illawarra Hawks]]) NBL basketball team in July 2014 right before the start of the 2014/2015 season.{{Cite news|url=http://www.illawarramercury.com.au/story/2416935/its-official-james-spenceley-takes-on-wollongong-hawks/|title=It's official: James Spenceley takes on Wollongong Hawks|last=KEEBLE|first=TIM|date=2014-07-14|work=Illawarra Mercury|access-date=2017-11-28|language=en}} In October 2014 he laid out his plan to win a Grand Final within 3 years.{{Cite news|url=http://www.illawarramercury.com.au/story/2615373/spenceley-lays-platform-for-a-new-hawks-era/|title=Spenceley lays platform for a new Hawks era|date=2014-10-09|work=Illawarra Mercury|access-date=2017-11-28|language=en}} The team finished last in the [[2014–15 NBL season|2014/2015 season]], 4th in the [[2015–16 NBL season|2015/2016 season]] and was runner up in the [[2016–17 NBL season|2016/2017 season]] losing in the Grand Final to the [[Perth Wildcats]].{{cite web |title=Resilient Illawarra Hawks prove pundits wrong to make NBL grand final |url=http://www.abc.net.au/news/2017-02-24/illawarra-hawks-defy-odds-to-make-nbl-grand-final/8299948 |website=ABC News |accessdate=22 June 2018 |language=en-AU |date=24 February 2017}} In February 2018 Spenceley announced he had sold his share in the Illawarra Hawks.{{Cite club|last=Mee|first=Cameron|date=2018-02-06|work=Illawarra Mercury|access-date=2018-05-28|language=en}} He is an active [[Venture capitalist|Venture Capital investor]],{{cite web |title=Telco boss turned fund manager James Spenceley on small caps investing |url=https://www.afr.com/markets/telco-boss-turned-fund-manager-james-spenceley-on-small-caps-investing-20171209-h01xid |website=Financial {{multiple| {{external links|date=March 2018}} {{BLP sources|date=March 2018}} {{more footnotes|date=January 2014}} }}{{Infobox person | name = Kenes Rakishev | birth_name = Kenges Rakishev | birth_date = 14/07/1979 | nationality = Kazakhstan | education = AMP Diploma from Oxford University (UK) B.A International Economics from Kazakh Economic University, Almaty (KZ) Law degree from KAzakh National Law Academy, Almaty (KZ) | website = www.kenesrakishev.com }}
'''Kenes Rakishev''', a prominent [[Kazakhstan|Kazakh]] entrepreneur and investor. He takes the top 5 spot out of 50 influential businessmen in Kazakhstan according to Forbes Kazakhstan annual ranking [http://forbes.kz/ranking/50_samyih_vliyatelnyih_biznesmenov_kazahstana_-_2015 "The top 50 most influential businessmen in Kazakhstan"] and the top 7 spot in Forbes Kazakhstan annual ranking [http://forbes.kz/leader/50_bogateyshih_biznesmenov_kazahstana_-_2016 "The 50 richest people in Kazakhstan"]. Kenges is one of the founders of the global venture fund [http://www.singulariteam.com/ SingulariTeam], a private investment fund that focuses on the development of technology based companies, by providing capital and additional supporting services all around the world. According to buzzsparks.org in 2012 he was considered among the [http://buzzsparks.org/year/2012/investors-private world's top 10 private investors] by the amount of the investments made. He serves as the chairman of the board of directors for several large companies including SAT & Company (KASE: SATC), a diversified industrial holding. Benefitting from Kenges’ leadership, SAT & Co., which has interests in mining, mechanical engineering, infrastructure projects and petrochemical operations as well as plants and projects in Turkey and China, has grown from its initial investment of $10K in 2000 to more than $500M today. He is the controlling shareholder of the largest Kazakh commercial bank - [[Kazkommertsbank|JSC "Kazkommertsbank"]] (LSE:KKB), as well as the bank's chairman of the board of Directors.
He also serves as the chairman of Net Element ([http://www.nasdaq.com/symbol/nete/stock-report NASDAQ:NETE]) after acquiring $32 million in Net Element stock in 2012. The investment into Net Element is part of Kenges’ strategy to apply his expertise and access to capital to seize opportunities in the [[Commonwealth of Independent States]] (CIS) countries by leveraging advanced technologies and partnerships abroad.
Kenges is the member of directors' board and the strategic partner of one of the biggest Russian venture funds [http://www.fastlaneventures.ru/?lang=en_us Fastlane Ventures]. He also is one of the significant shareholders of the [http://www.centralasiametals.com/company-information/significant-investors/ Central Asia Metals PLC] (LSE: CAML.L) mining company, holding 19,01% shares.
Throughout his career, Kenges has served in several top positions in both the public and private sector, ranging from head of marketing for KazTransGas and Intergas Central Asia to advisor for the Kazakhstan Interior Ministry and Department of Education.
== Recent Investments == * [http://www.Rall.ee Rall.ee], $1 million, First Round, November 6, 2012 * [[Mobli]], $20 million, Series B, September 9, 2012 * [[TriPlay]], $5 million, Series C, August 22, 2012 * [[Net Element]], $32 million in stock acquisition, February 23, 2012 * [[Fast Lane Ventures]], $13 million, December 6, 2012 * [http://genesisangels.com/ Genesis Angels], $100 million fund, April 19, 2013 * [https://finance.yahoo.com/news/sprylogics-international-corp-announces-name-195100268.html Sprylogics International], Rakishev entered the Consultative Council of the company. * [http://www.iqcard.ru/ IQcard.ru], $3,7 million investment in December, 2013 * [http://forbes.kz/finances/markets/rakishev_stanet_strategicheskim_investorom_seti_magnum Magnum Cash & Carry], large retail chain in Kazakhstan. In 2014 it was announced that Rakishev has non controlling stake in this company. The exact share size was not disclosed. Company's annual revenues exceed several hundred US dollars.
== Education == Kenges earned a diploma from the Oxford [[Saïd Business School]] in Advanced Management in 2007 and a certificate from the [[London Business School]] in Developing Strategy for Value Creation in 2007. He earned degrees in economics from the T. Ryskulov’ Kazakh Economic University in 2002 and law from the Kazakh National Law Academy in 2000.
== Personal life == Kenges was born in July 14, 1979 to a family of the prominent Kazakh statesman and public figure Khamit Rakishev, who, for many years was the Head of the [[Chamber of commerce|Kazakhstan's Chamber of Commerce and Industry]]. He is the son-in-law of [[Imangali Tasmagambetov|Imangali Tasmagambetov, the current Minister of Defence of Kazakhstan]].
== Industrial Assets == Since November 2006 Kenges Rakishev is the large shareholder and chairman of the board of SAT & Company (KASE: SATC), a diversified industrial holding combining more than 30 companies across different industrial sectors, such as mining, metallurgy, construction, mechanical engineering, oil trading, minerals exploration and recycling. From 2008 Sat & Company rapidly increased its international presence through acquisition of the new assets in China and Turkey (ferroalloy plants and mining companies exploring ferroalloys, chrome, nickel, zinc and coal). According to Bloomberg, by the beginning of 2013 market capitalization of Sat & Company made up $500 mln. By December 2015 Rakishev [http://vlast.kz/novosti/14491-rakisev-uvelicil-svou-dolu-v-sat-company.html gained control over 75,61%] of the company's shares.
In June 27, 2013 Central Asia Metals plc (LSE:CAML), an international producer of the cathode copper [http://www.morningstar.co.uk/uk/news/AN_1400596575572443000/central-asia-metals-becomes-sole-owner-of-kazakh-copper-project.aspx became the sole owner of Kounrad copper project] in Kazakhstan by exchanging 20% of CAML shares into 40% of Kounrad stake owned by Kenges. Thus, Kenges was appointed as non-executive director of Central Asia Metals plc.
On March 13, 2014 Kenges Rakishev joined the board of directors of [http://www.ke.kz/en/company/Opisanie_kompanii/ JSC "National Company "Kazakhstan Engineering"] - large holding combining 27 enterprises of the defensive industry and munitions factories of the Ministry of Defence of the Republic of Kazakhstan. He left the board one year later, upon the appointment of [[Imangali Tasmagambetov]] as the new Minister of Defence.
== Financial assets == In 2010 Kenges Rakishev had the status of the major participant of the "Otan" accumulative pension fund. In 2012 he became the shareholder of the "Respublika" accumulative pension fund. Currently, he is the major shareholder of the "Standard" insurance company - 22,34% shares. In March 2013 he has acquired the status of the major participant of JSC " Bank Astana-Finance" and in July 2015 he has left the register of the shareholders of this financial institution.
On February 6, 2014 JSC [[Kazkommertsbank]] and Kenes Rakishev reached a final agreement to acquire 46.5% of the shares of JSC [[BTA Bank]] each from JSC National Welfare Fund [[Samruk-Kazyna]]. The acquisition and subsequent merger of BTA and KKB were expected to create the largest universal bank in the region, creating a large-scale diversified institution with an assets more than 1.5x larger than the next competitor.
On February 14, 2014 Kenges has [http://en.tengrinews.kz/companies/Kenes-Rakishev-new-chairman-of-BTA-Bank-Board-of-Directors-26065/ become the new chairman] of Kazakhstan-based BTA Bank's board of directors. The decision was made during the extraordinary meeting of the bank shareholders.
On January 19, 2015 by the decision of the extraordinary meeting of JSC Kazkommertsbank shareholders, Kenges Rakishev was elected as the new member of the board of directors, representing the shareholders' interests.
In March 2015 he has become the large shareholder of JSC Kazkommertsbank, controlling the 16,02% of the shares by the acquiring 127 777 704 of the ordinary shares.
By the beginning of August 2015, Rakishev increased its stake in Kazkommertsbank to 28,67% and then [http://en.kkb.kz/page/News_070815_1 announced the preliminary agreement] with Alnair Capital Holding (another large shareholder of the bank, controlling 28,08% of its shares) to combine their respective shareholdings in Kazkommertsbank. As a result of the proposed transaction, Mr. Rakishev would acquire legal ownership over the parent entity of JSC Alnair Capital Holding, becoming its General Partner and, as such, would effectively acquire control over voting and other rights of Alnair’s shareholding in Kazkommertsbank (controlling 56.75% of bank's shares in total).
On December 29, 2015 the above-mentioned deal was closed.<ref>{{Cite news|url = http://en.kkb.kz/page/News_291215_1|title = JSC Kazkommertsbank|last = |first = |date = |work = |access-date = |via = }}</ref> Rakishev became Alnair Capital Holding's General Partner. Thus, the amount of shares under his control grew to 56,75 %.
In April 2016 Mr. Rakishev significantly increased his stake in Kazkommertsbank by reaching agreement with Mr. Nurzhan Subkhanberdin and JSC Central Asian Investment Company (CAIC) on acquisition of common shares of the Bank owned by Mr. Subkhanberdin and CAIC.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://en.kkb.kz/page/News_200416_1|title=bank press-release|last=|first=|date=|work=|access-date=|via=}}</ref> Under the terms of this transaction Mr. Kenges Rakishev acquired 115,486,789 common shares from CAIC. As a result, Mr. Rakishev’s direct holding in KKB increased from 28.67% to 43.15%, and he directly and indirectly (through JSC Qazaq Financial Group) controls 71.23% of KKB common shares. Soon after the deal announcement Kenges has been elected as the Kazkommertsbank's chairman of the Board of Directors.
== Venture Business == In 2012 Rakishev has expanded the range of his business interests to venture investments in the perspective innovation startups in the USA, Canada, Israel and Russia. He started to position himself as an independent investor and entrepreneur. After the acquisition of the major stake in US based Net Element company he has got the honorable nickname "the first Kazakh at NASDAQ". In March 2015 Net Element has acquired one of the Russia's e-payment market leaders - [https://payonline.ru/en/whoweare/ [[PayOnline]]] company.
On December 6, 2012 Kenges has acquired the share in the capital and joined the board of directors of the biggest Russian venture fund [http://www.fastlaneventures.ru/?lang=en_us Fastlane Ventures]. In 2011 Forbes magazine placed Fastlane Ventures second in its ranking of the largest investors in Russia, mostly due to its huge $100 million portfolio. The fund's key partners are [[VTB Capital|VTB capital]], Direct Group, [[e.ventures]].
By the end of 2012 Kenges has joined the [http://buzzsparks.org/year/2012/investors-private TOP 10 world's private investors] ranking together with such famous venture capitalists as [[Peter Thiel|Peter Tiehl]] and [[Yuri Milner]].
In April, 2013 Kenges Rakishev together with [https://www.crunchbase.com/person/moshe-hogeg#/entity Moshe Hogeg] (prominent serial technology entrepreneur) co-founded [http://www.singulariteam.com/ SingulariTeam] venture fund with the capital of $10 mln. The fund was founded with the aim of searching and financing breakthrough startups in such a disruptive industries as robotics, AI, VR, augmented reality, commercial space, etc.
In 2013, Mobli - the visual social platform application in which Kenges has a major stake, attracted the then most richest person in the world [[Carlos Slim]] as the new investor. He put $60 mln. in Mobli and it is worth mentioning that Mobli became the only second investment of Carlos Slim in the hi-tech market after Shazam. [[Mobli]] and Slim's [[América Móvil|America Movil]] reached an agreement to preinstall the application on all the new smartphones sold by this mobile operator.
In December 2013 Rakishev took part in the Russian IQCard financing round, putting $3,7 mln. in to its capital. Created in 2012 IQCard specializes in developing and servicing various loyalty programs for retail chains on the basis of prepaid bank cards. In 2013 the company started collaboration with Visa, by releasing the first Russian gold prepaid card and realized partnership with world's biggest tourist operator TUI Russia & CIS as well as Russian bookstores chain "Respublika". Thanks to agreement with Samsung, IQCard will also be featured in Samsung Wallet app.
== Media business == In December 2015 mr. Rakishev announced a deal of acquiring 100% shares of [http://tv7.kz/ru "Sedmoy Kanal"], national TV channel. The amount of transaction was not disclosed. [http://kapital.kz/business/46212/kenes-rakishev-priobretet-100-akcij-sedmogo-kanala.html According to comments from Rakishev's advisor], the deal should be closed by the end of the year.
== Public Life == Kenges is the member of presidium of the National Economic Chamber "Atameken Union" and member of Youth Policy Council "Zhas Kenes" working under the auspices of the President of Kazakhstan. In November 2013 he became the Chairman of the Board of Directors of [[Enactus Kazakhstan]] non-commercial organization. In December 2014 he became the Head of the Youth Entrepreneurship Development Council at the National Chamber for Entrepreneurship.
Kenges Rakishev is known as big Maecenas: he actively supports all the initiatives of [http://eng.saby.kz/ "Sabi" charity fund]. He takes active part in the development of Kazakh sports. His Sat & Company holding was the official sponsor of Kazakh Football Federation and Kazakh Federation for Professional Boxing. In 2012 by the initiative of Kenges, Sat & Company became the General Sponsor of Rapid Chess World Championship and FIDE 2012 Blitz, held in Astana city. * in 2004 - Kenges is elected as the vice-president of National Sports Association of Kazakhstan. He is the co-author of "Kazanat" book, dedicated to the history and the development of horse-breeding in Kazakhstan, and "Berkut" book, dedicated to the history and traditions of Kazakh national falcon hunting. * in 2009 - Kenges heads the Almaty city branch of Kazakhstan Boxing Federation. * in 2010 - Kenges is elected as vice-president of [http://www.kfb.kz/eng Kazakhstan Boxing Federation]. * in 2011 - Kenges is elected as vice-president of the (ASBC) Asian Boxing Confederation. * in 2012 Kenges is elected as the new President of [[Kazakhstan Judo Federation]]
== Honors & Awards == Kenges was designated by [[Forbes]] as one of the 50 most influential people in [[Kazakhstan]], was awarded the medal of "20 years of independence of the Republic of Kazakhstan", the medal of "10 years of the city of [[Astana]]", and was awarded a special appreciation letter from the President of the Republic of Kazakhstan, Mr. Nursultan Abishevich Nazarbayev. He owns the highest award of the Chechen Republic - the Order of Akhmat Kadyrov. In December 15, 2015 he was awarded "Kurmet" Order.

{{About||the Malian newspaper|Les Échos (Mali)}} {{Use dmy dates|date=April 2015}} {{Infobox newspaper |name = Les Échos |logo = Logo Les Échos.svg |logo_size = 240px |image = [[File:Les Échos frontpage.JPG|260px|border]] |caption = |type = Daily financial newspaper |format = [[Berliner (format)|Berliner]] |foundation = {{start date and age|1908}} |owners = [[LVMH]] |headquarters = [[Paris]] |chiefeditor = Henri Gibier |political = [[Economic liberalism]] |opeditor = |publisher= Groupe Les Échos |circulation = 120,546 (July 2011-July 2012) |language = French |ISSN = 0153-4831 |website = [http://www.lesechos.fr lesechos.fr] }} '''''Les Échos''''' is the first daily [[France|French]] financial [[newspaper]], edited in [[Paris]] since 1908.
==History and profile== The paper was established as a monthly publication under the name of ''Les Échos de l’Exportation'' by the brothers Robert and [[Émile Servan-Schreiber]] in 1908.<ref name="urlLes Echos vendus">{{cite web |url=http://www.francetvinfo.fr/economie/medias/les-echos-vendus-a-lvmh-la-tribune-a-news-participations-les-rachats-font-flores-dans-la-presse-economique_220423.html |title="Les Echos" vendus à LVMH, "La Tribune" à... News Participations ? Les rachats font flores dans la presse économique |work= |accessdate=2016-08-02}}</ref><ref name="urlHistory of Groupe Les Echos">{{cite web |url=http://www.fundinguniverse.com/company-histories/groupe-les-echos-history/ |title=History of Groupe Les Echos – FundingUniverse |format= |work= |accessdate=2016-08-02}}</ref> It became a daily newspaper in 1928 and was renamed as ''Les Échos''.<ref>{{cite web|title=European News Resources|url=http://guides.nyu.edu/content.php?pid=74313&sid=704214|work=NYU Libraries|accessdate=24 January 2015}}</ref><ref name="urlLes Echos vendus"/><ref name="urlHistory of Groupe Les Echos"/> The newspaper was bought by the British media group [[Pearson PLC]] in 1988, and was sold to the French luxury goods conglomerate [[LVMH]] in November 2007.<ref>{{cite web|title=Les Echos|url=http://www.worldcrunch.com/source-partner/les-echos-15.html#.VHD-xFesUX4|work=Worldcrunch|accessdate=22 November 2014}}</ref><ref name=bbc>{{cite news|title=VMH buys Les Echos from Pearson|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/business/7080079.stm|accessdate=22 November 2014|work=BBC|date=5 November 2007}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=France -- Media Guide 2008|url=http://fas.org/irp/dni/osc/france-media.pdf|work=Open Source Center|accessdate=1 March 2015|date=16 July 2008}}</ref> The publisher of the paper is Groupe Les Échos.<ref name=euro/>
''Les Échos'' has a [[Liberalism|liberal]] stance and is published on weekdays.<ref name=euro>{{cite web|title=Les Echos|url=http://www.eurotopics.net/en/home/medienindex/media_articles/?frommedia=1371|work=Euro Topics|accessdate=22 November 2014}}</ref> The paper is headquartered in Paris and has a website which was launched in 1996.<ref name=vox/><ref>{{cite web|title=Daily Newspapers: First in a Series on the French Media|url=http://www.wikileaks.ch/cable/2006/11/06PARIS7251.html|work=Wikileaks|accessdate=24 February 2015|date=6 November 2006|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150207141142/http://www.wikileaks.ch/cable/2006/11/06PARIS7251.html|archivedate=7 February 2015|df=dmy-all}}</ref> The paper publishes economical analyses by leading economists, including [[Joseph Stiglitz]] and [[Kenneth Rogoff]].<ref name=vox>{{cite web|title=Les Echos|url=http://www.voxeurop.eu/en/content/source-information/71401-les-echos|work=Vox Europ|accessdate=22 November 2014}}</ref>
In September 2003 ''Les Échos'' switched from [[tabloid format]] to [[Berliner format]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Size matters... if you are a Brit|url=http://www.mediaweek.co.uk/article/516459/size-matters-brit|accessdate=23 February 2015|work=MediaWeek|date=13 July 2004}}</ref> In 2004, the newspaper won the [[European Project for Ice Coring in Antarctica|EPICA]] award.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.epica-awards.com/pages/pastresults2004_epicador_press.html|title=Epica d'Or 2004 (print)|year=2008|work=Epica Awards|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20081205095633/http://www.epica-awards.com/pages/pastresults2004_epicador_press.html|archivedate=5 December 2008|accessdate=28 September 2013}}</ref>
In 2010, the coverage of ''Les Échos'' was expanded to cover such topics as innovations in science, technologies, green growth, medicine and health and skills concerning marketing and advertising, management, education, strategy and leadership, law and finance.<ref name=pub10>{{cite news|title=Business daily Les Echos offers a new model with a new layout and expands its digital offer|url=http://www.publicitas.com/singapore/media-news-events/news-detail/?newsid=43070&title=france-business-daily-les-echos-offers-a-new-model-with-a-new-layout-and-expands-its-digital-offer#.VHEGFVesUX4|accessdate=22 November 2014|work=Publicitas|date=7 September 2010}}</ref> The former separate sections of IT and communications were merged under the section of high tech and media.
In 2013 the newspaper started a project called LesEchos360, a business news aggregation platform.<ref>{{cite news|author1=Rachel McAthy|title=France's Les Echos launching business news aggregation|url=https://www.journalism.co.uk/news/france-s-les-echos-launching-business-news-aggregation/s2/a553361/|work=Journalism|accessdate=22 November 2014|date=21 June 2013}}</ref>
==Circulation== In 2000 ''Les Échos'' was the sixth best-selling newspaper in France with a circulation of 728,000 copies.<ref>{{cite book|editor1=Mary Kelly|editor2=Gianpietro Mazzoleni|editor3=Denis McQuail|title=The Media in Europe: The Euromedia Handbook|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=yPS8edN_aJUC&pg=PA76|accessdate=24 April 2015|date=17 December 2003|publisher=SAGE Publications|isbn=978-1-4129-3260-8|page=76}}</ref> The 2009 circulation of the paper was 127,000 copies.<ref name=euro/> From July 2011 to July 2012 the paper had a circulation of 120,546 copies.<ref>{{cite news|title=New layout for Les Echos|url=http://www.publicitas.com/singapore/media-news-events/news-detail/?newsid=90566&title=france-new-layout-for-les-echos#.VHEHrFesUX4|accessdate=22 November 2014|work=Publicitas|date=7 November 2012}}</ref>

Owner of '''[[AEK B.C.|AEK Athens B.C.]]''' | title = | salary = | | height = | weight = | term = | predecessor = | successor = | party = | boards = | religion = | spouse = | partner = | children = 3 | parents = | relatives = | signature = | website = | footnotes = }} '''Mavroeidis "Makis" Angelopoulos''' (alternate spellings: Mavroidis, Makis, Aggelopoulos) ([[Greek language|Greek]]: Μαυροειδής "Μάκης" Αγγελόπουλος) is the co-owner of the [[basketball]] team [[AEK B.C.|AEK Athens]]. ==Early life== Angelopoulos was born in [[Nea Smyrni]], [[Greece]] and was raised in [[Athens]]. ==Business career== ===Neurosoft=== Neurosoft was founded back in 1994. Currently maintains subsidiaries in [[Cyprus]] and [[Romania]] and presence in [[Albania]], [[Serbia]] and [[Bulgaria]]. Since 2009 started on the AIM market of the [[Borsa Italiana]], the trading of company's shares. In fact, it was the first IT company entered this market. Also, shareholders in the company are [[OPAP]] (with a rate of 30%) and [[International Game Technology|Lottomatica/Gtech]] (with a rate of 16.6%). ===AEK Athens B.C.=== In October, 2014, Angelopoulos became active for Greek basketball team [[AEK B.C.|AEK]], in order to bring the club back to success. On November 24, 2014, Angelopoulos became [[shareholder]] of AEK after he took the majority stake of the team (with a rate of 76%).{{cite web|title = Makis Angelopoulos (76% of AEK B.C.)| url = http://www.news.gr/athlhtika/mpasket/article/193433/ston-makh-aggelopoylo-me-76-h-mpasketikh-aek.html | publisher = news.gr | accessdate =}} On October 9, 2015, Angelopoulos became chairman of AEK B.C. {{cite web|title = New AEK B.C. chairman| url = http://www.sport-fm.gr/article/basket/proedros-stin-aek-o-aggelopoulos/3114002 | publisher = sport-fm.gr | accessdate =}} ==References== ==External links== *[http://aekbc.gr/en/ AEK B.C. site] {{AEK Athens B.C.}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Angelopoulos, Makis}} [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Greek businesspeople]] [[Category:AEK B.C.]] [[Category:Greek basketball chairmen and investors]] [[Category:1964 births]]

{{Infobox software | title = Oracle Communications
MetaSolv Solution | logo = [[File:Oracle logo.svg|250px]] | logo alt = Oracle Corporation Logo | logo caption = Oracle Corporation | logo size = 250px | screenshot = | screenshot alt = | caption = | collapsible = | author = MetaSolv Software, Inc | developer = Jim Janicki (and others) | released = | discontinued = | ver layout = | latest release version = 6.3 | latest release date = | latest preview version = | latest preview date = | repo = | programming language = | operating system = | platform = | size = | language = | language count = | language footnote = | genre = [[Operations Support System]] | license = [[Proprietary software|Proprietary]] [[Commercial Software]] | alexa = | website = | standard = | AsOf = }} '''MetaSolv Solution''' (''also known as MetaSolv or MSS'') is an [[Operations Support System]] [[database application]] originally created by MetaSolv Software, Inc. for use by the telcommunications industry. The company was acquired by [[Oracle Corporation]], and Oracle still supports the application today under the umbrella of [[Oracle Corporation#Corporate structures|Oracle Communications]]. The software is used by many telecom companies (not just [[Telephone company|telephone]], but [[Internet service provider|ISPs]], [[List of cable television companies|cable companies]], and more).{{cite web |url=https://community.oracle.com/groups/metasolv-sig |title=MetaSolv User Group |website=Community.Oracle.com |publisher=Oracle |access-date=September 21, 2018}} == History == When MetaSolv was originally developed in the early [[1990s]], the new application was first referred to as '''ASAP''' (''Access Services and Provisioning''). ASAP provided a method for tracking [[Inventory|equipment inventory]], port consumption and circuit designs for engineering departments within telecom companies. But, by 1997, the need for tracking [[Work order|customer service orders]] was identified, and the system enhanced to provide for it. Along with order tracking, the need for [[Workflow|workflow]] management was also addressed. By the late 1990s, the application was rebranded by the company as '''TBS''' (''Telecom Business Solution'') from version 3.10 through version 4.11, until the introduction of the 5.0 version. At that time (''about 2003''), MetaSolv Inc again rebranded the application, this time to '''MetaSolv Solution''', also known as M/5. The latest release is often simply referred to simply as '''M6'''. MetaSolv Inc had several other products besides M6, and made efforts to provide seamless [[System integration|integration]] and connectivity between MetaSolv and those products in various ways. After Oracle acquired MetaSolv Inc (see below), Oracle absorbed all of MetaSolv Inc's products and continued the trend of integrating them. Even without those integrations, MetaSolv is a stand-alone OSS application that supports service provisioning through the entire life-cycle of customer and network development. == Oracle Acquisition == MetaSolv Software Inc. (''Nasdaq: MSLV'') was privately founded in 1992 soon becoming a leading provider of service fulfillment solutions designed to meet the needs of telecommunications providers. MetaSolv Inc became a publicly traded company offering an [[Initial public offering|IPO]] in 1999.{{cite web |url= https://www.nasdaq.com/markets/ipos/company/metasolv-inc-10266-2893 |title= NASDAQ - MetaSolv Inc (MSLV) IPO |date= |website= NASDAQ |publisher= |access-date= July 25, 2018}} MetaSolv (''the company'') was acquired by Oracle in 2006 for $219 million. On December 15, 2006, a majority of MetaSolv stockholders approved Oracle's acquisition of MetaSolv Software Inc..{{cite web |url= http://www.orafaq.com/wiki/MetaSolv |title= Oracle FAQs - MetaSolv |date= December 2008 |last= Naude |first= Frank |website= OraFAQ |publisher= |access-date= July 26, 2018}} Oracle continues to offer and maintain the application today.{{cite web |url= https://www.oracle.com/corporate/acquisitions/metasolv/support.html |title= Oracle Acquisitions - Support for MetaSolv Products |date= |website= Oracle |publisher= |access-date= July 24, 2018}} == Description == === General Capabilities === MetaSolv Solution (''the software'') is an [[Oracle Database]] application sometimes described as "''Telco in a Box''".{{cite web |url= https://www.oracle.com/industries/communications/service-providers/products/metasolv-solution/index.html |title= Oracle Communications MetaSolv Solution |date= |website= Oracle |publisher= |access-date= July 26, 2018}} The system provides for many business processes common among all types of telecommunications businesses including: * Ordering (Regulated and Unregulated) * [[Workflow Management]] * [[Inventory Management]] * [[Telecommunications engineering|Network Engineering]] * Network Infrastructure Management * [[Service Provisioning]] * Trouble Management Typical implementation of MetaSolv within any telecom company often include users from Customer Care, Service Ordering, Engineering, Switching, Central Office and Field Technician departments. === Industry Standards === Early in the development of the application, MetaSolv Inc realized the need to implement common industry standard practices such as those provided today by '''iConectiv''' (''previously known as [[Telcordia Technologies]], but rebranded after [[Ericsson]] acquired them''). These standards included such things as standard equipment identifiers, [[Circuit ID|circuit identification]], location identification (''commonly called [[CLLI code]]''), connection codes (''also known as Network Channel codes''), rate codes, and much more. Across the industry, such standards are typically provided by iConectiv in the form of [[Common Language Information Services]]. By adding these standards to MetaSolv, the application more properly fit into the telecom OSS industry. Later however, companies expressed an interest in varying from industry standards. Releases after version 6.0 (6.1, 6.2, etc) included the ability to do so in some areas. === Interfacing and Reporting === Today, MetaSolv is often interfaced with other telecom company [[OSS/BSS]] systems through [[Application programming interface|APIs]] and other means. Since the software is a front-end [[database application]] with an Oracle database behind it, multiple off-the-shelf [[SQL]]-based reporting tools are used to support [[business intelligence]] needs in several departments. == See Also == {{Portal|Telecommunication|Computing}} * [[List of acquisitions by Oracle]] * [[:Category:Oracle software|List of Wikipedia Articles about Oracle Software]] == References == {{reflist}} == External links == * [https://www.oracle.com/industries/communications/service-providers/products/metasolv-solution/index.html Oracle Communications MetaSolv Solution description page] * [http://www.oracle.com/us/industries/communications/communications-metasolv-ds-398152.pdf MetaSolv Datasheet] * [https://fenix.tecnico.ulisboa.pt/downloadFile/3779576328719/oracle-communications-metasolv-solution-whitepaper.pdf Oracle Communications MetaSolv Solution Overview whitepaper, Updated April 2007] * [https://community.oracle.com/groups/metasolv-sig Oracle Community - MetaSolv Users Group] {{oracle}} [[Category:Business software]][[Category:Database management systems]][[Category:Oracle software]][[Category:Oracle Database]][[Category:Telecommunications systems]]

{{Infobox person | name = Mikael Ljungman | education = Lawyer, Political Scientist | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1963|11|25}} | occupation = Businessman | birth_place= [[Östermalm]], [[Stockholm]], Sweden | nationality= Swedish | children = }}
'''Mikael Ljungman''' (born November 25, 1963) is a Swedish [[politician]], [[lawyer]] and [[businessman]]. He was convicted of fraud and false accounting related to his business activities, for which he served a two-year prison term.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.dr.dk/Nyheder/Andre_sprog/English/2010/03/26/142319.htm |title=Six-year sentence for Ljungman |date=26 March 2010}}</ref> He is also known for his association and involvement with two high-profile tech failures: the game console manufacturer [[Gizmondo]] in 2006 and [[IT Factory]] in 2008. After his release from prison, Ljungman became active in the [[Christian Democrats (Sweden)|Christian Democrats]] legal policy network.<ref name="political scientist">{{cite web |url=http://www.business.dk/oekonomi/bagger-makker-kommer-ud-af-faengslet-0 |title=Bagger-makker kommer ud af fængslet }}</ref> He was selected as the [[Christian Democrats (Sweden)|Christian Democrats]] parliamentary candidate for the 2014 Swedish elections.<ref name="Parliament Election 2014_2">{{cite news |url=http://www.aftonbladet.se/nyheter/article19057212.ab |title=Känd brottsling på KD:s riksdagslista |trans-title=Known criminal on KD's parliamentary list |newspaper=Aftonbladet |language=Swedish |date=15 June 2014}}</ref>
==Education== Mikael Ljungman has a Masters of Laws (LL.M.)<ref name="Parliament Election 2014">{{cite web |url=http://www.val.se/val/val2014/valsedlar/R/rvalkrets/01/valsedlar.html |title=Ballot Papers Election 2014}}</ref>{{Unreliable source?|date=February 2016}} from [[Stockholm University]]. He also studied political science.<ref name="political scientist"/>
==Association with Gizmondo== Ljungman's company 3P PreForm Marketing and Research began performing research and development work for [[Gizmondo]] Europe in 2003<ref name="prosecution">{{cite news |url=http://www.realtid.se/ArticlePages/200512/22/20051222120813_Realtid483/20051222120813_Realtid483.dbp.asp |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160205052025/http://www.realtid.se/ArticlePages/200512/22/20051222120813_Realtid483/20051222120813_Realtid483.dbp.asp |archivedate=5 February 2016 |title=Gizmondos svenska partner åtalas |date=December 22, 2005|author=Olle Blomkvist |publisher=Realtid.se}}</ref><ref name="giz">{{cite web |url=http://sandberghans.blogspot.com/2008/02/carl-freer-gizmondo-arrives-late-2008.html |title=Carl Freer: Gizmondo arrives in late 2008}}</ref> and was paid $7.6 million.<ref name="TGTL10Q-Oct05">{{cite web |url=http://yahoo.brand.edgar-online.com/displayfilinginfo.aspx?FilingID=3965271-21910-50927&type=sect&TabIndex=2&companyid=77277&ppu=%252fdefault.aspx%253fcik%253d1065581 |title=TIGER TELEMATICS INC - TGTL Quarterly Report (10-Q)}}</ref>{{Unreliable source?|date=February 2016}} After Gizmondo Europe's bankruptcy in early 2006, the liquidators had outstanding questions about Ljungman and his company's involvement with Gizmondo Europe Ltd; they were perfectly satisfied with Ljungman's answers.<ref name="giz"/>{{Unreliable source?|date=February 2016}} In May 2008, [[Carl Freer]] bought Gizmondo Europe's intellectual property rights.<ref name="iprights">{{cite web |url=http://sandberghans.blogspot.com/2008/05/gizmondo-press-release-from-joint.html |title=Gizmondo Liquidators Wishes Carl Freer Good Speed}}</ref>{{Unreliable source?|date=February 2016}} Ljungman worked with Freer on the relaunch of the Gizmondo, with Freer calling him his "co-pilot".<ref name="giz"/>{{Unreliable source?|date=February 2016}} He traveled to China in early 2008 to arrange manufacturing,<ref name="businessman">{{cite web|url=http://www2.unt.se/article/1,1786,MC=77-AV_ID=725894,00.html?from=latestnav |title=Omskrivet företag satsar på nytt |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110809095436/http://www.unt.se/article/1%2C1786%2CMC%3D77-AV_ID%3D725894%2C00.html?from=latestnav |archivedate=August 9, 2011 |df= }}</ref> a contract purported to be worth $300M.<ref name="giz"/>{{Unreliable source?|date=February 2016}} The relaunch of [[Gizmondo]] never materialized.<ref name="droidgamer">{{cite web |url=http://www.droidgamers.com/index.php/game-news/android-game-news/1130-the-android-gaming-platform-that-never-was-gizmondo-2 |title=The Android gaming platform that never was: Gizmondo 2 |date=2011-01-16}}</ref>
==Conviction for false accounting== Ljungman was arrested on October 19, 2004, but released shortly thereafter pending trial.<ref name="preform">{{cite web |url=http://www.aftonbladet.se/nyheter/article323691.ab |title=1,6 miljarder kronor försvann från bolaget - på ett halvår}}</ref> Ljungman was found guilty of false accounting and tax evasion on January 26, 2009. Ljungman initially received a two-year prison sentence;<ref name="Realtid">{{cite news|url=http://www.realtid.se/ArticlePages/200901/16/20090116103859_Realtid083/20090116103859_Realtid083.dbp.asp|title=Mikael Ljungman fick fängelse|last=Johansson|first=Sara|date=2009-01-26|publisher=Realtid.se|language=Swedish|quote=I dag kom domen mot Carl Freers kompanjon Mikael Ljungman. Han fick 10 månaders fängelse och näringsförbud.|accessdate=2009-01-29}}</ref> which was reduced to 10 months on appeal after the tax evasion charges were dismissed. The sentence included disqualification from running a company in Sweden for five years, which was reduced to three years starting from 2007 after the successful appeal.<ref name="verdict">{{cite web|url=http://www.realtid.se/ArticlePages/200901/16/20090116103859_Realtid083/20090116103859_Realtid083.dbp.asp?sAction=lk#k1 |title=Mikael Ljungman fick fängelse}}</ref> Ljungman's appeal went to the supreme court<ref name="appeal1">{{cite web |url=http://www.realtid.se/ArticlePages/200902/26/20090226115912_Realtid476/20090226115912_Realtid476.dbp.asp|title=Mikael Ljungman överklagar hovrättens dom|last=Johansson|first=Sara|date=2009-02-26|publisher=Realtid.se|language=Swedish|quote= Åklagaren har inte kunnat styrka brottet. Det menar Mikael Ljungmans advokat Leif Gustafsson. }}</ref> where it was denied<ref name="appeal2">{{cite web |url=http://www.realtid.se/ArticlePages/200903/18/20090318110802_Realtid128/20090318110802_Realtid128.dbp.asp|title=Klart i dag: Ljungman tvingas till fängelse|last=Johansson|first=Sara|date=2009-03-18|publisher=Realtid.se|language=Swedish}}</ref> and he was imprisoned in late April 2009.<ref name="itfactory-arrest">{{cite news |url=http://www.business.dk/article/20090427/ittele/90427079/ |title=Baggers partner anholdt |last=Bendtsen| first=Simon |date=2009-04-27 |publisher=Business dk |language=Danish |archivedate=28 April 2009|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090428134821/http://www.business.dk/article/20090427/ittele/90427079/ |quote="Jeg tror, at han netop var startet med at afsone de 10 måneder. Han er så nu blevet overført til arresten, og så må vi se, hvornår vi kan få ham udleveret til Danmark," siger vicestatsadvokat Per Justesen.}}</ref>
==IT Factory scandal== In December 2008 Danish company [[IT Factory]] went bankrupt revealing systematic financial fraud. Ljungman was linked to IT Factory's [[Chief executive officer|CEO]] [[Stein Bagger]],<ref name="car">{{cite web |url=http://www.business.dk/article/20081208/ittele/712070136/ |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20081211052909/http://www.business.dk/article/20081208/ittele/712070136/ |archivedate=11 December 2008 |title=Svensk forretningsmand hjalp Stein Bagger i USA}}</ref> who went missing four days before the company's collapse was publicly announced.<ref name="suspect">{{cite news |url=http://www.realtid.se/ArticlePages/200903/17/20090317092653_Realtid057/20090317092653_Realtid057.dbp.asp |title=Dansk polis är beredda att efterlysa Ljungman |date=2009-03-17 |first=Sara |last=Johansson |publisher=Realtid.se |language=Swedish |quote=Den danska polisen har ännu inte lyckats förhöra Mikael Ljungman, som misstänks vara delaktig i Stein Bagger-härvan.}}</ref> Bagger fled from Dubai to the United States and eventually surrendered to police in Los Angeles, where he was found to have Ljungman's car and to have used his credit card.
On January 9, 2009, the Deputy Attorney in charge of fraud cases in Denmark announced that they wanted to question Ljungman.<ref name="questioning">{{cite web |url=http://www.realtid.se/ArticlePages/200901/09/20090109134818_Realtid957/20090109134818_Realtid957.dbp.asp |title=Dansk polis vill förhöra Mikael Ljungman}}</ref> Danish police sent out an arrest warrant for Ljungman via [[Interpol]]. He was arrested by Swedish police in [[Norrköping]] where he had just started his ten-month sentence in an open prison and was extradited to Denmark on 27 July 2009.<ref>{{cite web|author=Erik Wiman |url=http://www.aftonbladet.se/nyheter/article4783683.ab |title=Den svenske företagaren och miljonären Mikael Ljungman gäckar polisen |publisher=[[Aftonbladet]] |date=2009-03-31 |accessdate=2013-11-18}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|author=Af Simon Bendtsen 27. april 2009, 12:03 |url=http://www.business.dk/article/20090427/ittele/90427079/ |archivedate=28 April 2009|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090428134821/http://www.business.dk/article/20090427/ittele/90427079/ |title=Baggers partner anholdt - Digital |publisher=[[Berlingske]] |date= |accessdate=2013-11-18}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.cphpost.dk/business/119-business/46406-baggers-partner-pleads-not-guilty.html |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110807050211/http://www.cphpost.dk/business/119-business/46406-baggers-partner-pleads-not-guilty.html |archivedate=7 August 2011|title=Bagger's partner pleads not guilty |publisher=[[Copenhagen Post]] |date=2009-07-28}}</ref>
Danish media claimed that the Swedish police had found a fake leasing contract linking IT Factory with Xiop, a Swedish company where Ljungman had worked as Business Developer. This specific claim was denied by the Swedish prosecutor Yngve Rydberg.<ref name="questioning"/> Yngve Rydberg also said at the time there was no suspicion of Ljungman being involved in the crimes being investigated in Sweden.<ref name="raid">{{cite web |url=http://www.realtid.se/ArticlePages/200812/22/20081222201417_Realtid281/20081222201417_Realtid281.dbp.asp |title=Åklagare gjorde razzia hos Mikael Ljungman-bolag}}</ref> On the first day of his trial Stein Bagger named Ljungman as his accomplice.<ref name="accomplice">{{cite news |url=http://www.cphpost.dk/news/crime/45916-bagger-points-finger-at-swedish-partner.html |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20111113143801/http://www.cphpost.dk/news/crime/45916-bagger-points-finger-at-swedish-partner.html |archivedate=13 November 2011 |title=Bagger points finger at Swedish partner |date=2009-06-10 |publisher=[[Copenhagen Post]]}}</ref>
On 26 March 2010, Ljungman was convicted of involvement in the IT Factory fraud in Denmark,<ref name="it-charge">{{cite news |url=http://www.fyens.dk/article/1566299:Business-Fyn--Ljungman-anker-dommen-paa-seks-aars-faengsel |title=Ljungman anker dommen på seks års fængsel |publisher=Fyenske |date=2010-03-26}}</ref> and was released under supervision in September 2013 after serving slightly less than half of a seven-year sentence.<ref name="release-from-prison">{{cite news |url=http://www.business.dk/oekonomi/bagger-makker-kommer-ud-af-faengslet-0 |title=Bagger-makker kommer ud af fængslet |publisher=[[Berlingske]] |date=2013-09-20 |accessdate=2013-12-23}}</ref>
Ljungman denied involvement in Stein Bagger's fraud and appealed his sentence,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.fyens.dk/article/1566299:Business-Fyn--Ljungman-anker-dommen-paa-seks-aars-faengsel |title=Ljungman anker dommen pl' seks l'rs fc'ngsel |publisher=[[Fyens Stiftstidende]] |date= |accessdate=2013-11-18}}</ref> however as of the time of his supervised release, no successful appeal had been completed. Ljungman claimed he was interested in IT Factory's software ''PaaS'',<ref name="buy out">{{cite web |url=http://www.realtid.se/ArticlePages/200901/26/20090126154337_Realtid235/20090126154337_Realtid235.dbp.asp|title=Vi funderar på att överklaga domen |last=Johansson|first=Sara|date=2009-01-26|publisher=Realtid.se|language=Swedish|quote= Utredningen stödjer helt enkelt inte att han har gjort de brott som åklagaren påstår. }}</ref> that he and Media Power tried to buy when IT Factory was liquidated. The software was instead sold to a German company.<ref name="Paas">{{cite web |url=http://bizzen.blogs.business.dk/2009/02/25/tysk-k%c3%b8ber-af-it-factorys-flagskib-software-overlever/|title=Tysk køber af IT Factorys software. Mikael Ljungman fik nej}}</ref>
In December 2012, Danish authorities recovered a portion of the money stolen from IT Factory from accounts in Hong Kong and Jersey belonging to Mikael Ljungman.<ref name="cp2012">{{cite news |url=http://cphpost.dk/news/stolen-millions-confiscated-from-bagger-accomplice.3697.html |title=Stolen millions confiscated from Bagger accomplice |publisher=Copenhagen Post |quote=2.3 million kroner, hidden by Mikael Ljungman in accounts in Jersey and Hong Kong, are set to return to Denmark }}</ref>
==Political activity== Shortly after he had served his prison term he was selected as parliamentary candidate for the [[Christian Democrats (Sweden)|Christian Democrats]] in the 2014 Swedish elections as well as their representative in the municipal elections and county council elections.<ref name="Parliament Election 2014_2"/>

'''Mohamed Salleh s/o Kadir Mohideen Saibu Maricar'''<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://secondchance.com.sg/arpdf/Second%20Chance%20-%20AR2011.pdf|title=Annual Report 2011, Second Chance Properties Pte Ltd|pages=28|author=Mohamed Salleh Marican|website=www.secondchance.com.sg|language=en|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=2017-09-05}}</ref> (born 1949), usually referred to as '''Mohamed Salleh Marican''' or '''Salleh Marican''', is the founding Chairman and CEO of Second Chance Properties Ltd, a listed company on the [[Singapore Stock Exchange]]. His company is the first owned by a Malay and Muslim to be listed in Singapore.
==Early life and education== Born in 1949 in Joo Chiat, Salleh is the third of six siblings. His father, Kadir Marican, was from Pondicherry, India, while his mother, Salmah Mar’ie, came from Malaysian Borneo.<ref name=":0">{{Cite news|url=http://www.todayonline.com/singapore/uphill-task-run-president-believer-second-chances-undeterred|title=Uphill task to run for President, but believer in second chances is undeterred|work=TODAYonline|access-date=2017-08-25|language=en}}</ref> He attended [[Victoria School]] from 1962 to 1967. However, he dropped out of school before his A-Level Examinations.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.secondchance.com.sg/#bord|title=2ndChance:Board of Directors|last=|first=|date=|website=www.secondchance.com.sg|language=en|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=2017-08-25}}</ref> He performed his [[National Service in Singapore|National Service]] from 1968 to 1971 and left with the rank of lieutenant.
== Career == Salleh has more than 40 years of retail business experience.<ref name=":1">{{Cite news|url=https://sg.news.yahoo.com/presidential-election-2017-second-chance-ceo-salleh-marican-calls-halimah-yacob-good-candidate-114502214.html|title=Presidential Election 2017: Second Chance CEO Salleh Marican calls Halimah Yacob a ‘good candidate’|last=|first=|date=|work=Yahoo News Singapore|access-date=2017-08-25|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|language=en-SG}}</ref> He first went into menswear tailoring in 1975, and started his menswear label Second Chance, which expanded to 25 outlets in Singapore and Malaysia by 1988. In 1992, he diversified into Malay women’s fashion brand First Lady. He also started a jewellery business Golden Chance and went into the property business in the late 1990s.<ref name=":1" /> Mr Marican listed his firm on the Singapore Exchange in 1997.<ref name=":0" /> He owns 22 units at City Plaza.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://themiddleground.sg/2017/08/24/pe2017-interview-salleh-marican/|title=PE2017: Interview with Salleh Marican|last=Henson|first=Bertha|date=2017-08-24|website=The Middle Ground|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=2017-08-25}}</ref>
==Achievements== 1988 - Inaugural [[Singapore Malay Chamber of Commerce and Industry|SMCCI]]/BH Malay Businessman of the Year Award <ref name="secondchance.com.sg">{{cite web|title=Second Chance Properties Ltd - Board of Directors|url=http://www.secondchance.com.sg/#bord}}</ref>
1996 - Lianhe Zaobao and the Entrepreneurship Development Centre of Nanyang Technological University Entrepreneurship Excellence Award <ref name="secondchance.com.sg"/>
2011 - Berita Harian Achiever of the Year Award <ref>{{cite web|title=Media Releases - Singapore Press Holdings|url=http://www.sph.com.sg/media_releases/1261|website=Singapore Press Holdings}}</ref>
2012 - Ernst & Young Entrepreneur of the Year - Business and Consumer Products <ref>{{cite web|title=EY Entrepreneur Of The Year 2012 – Business and Consumer Products|url=http://www.ey.com/sg/en/about-us/entrepreneurship/entrepreneur-of-the-year/be-inspired_mohamed-salleh-marican|website=Ernst & Young Singapore}}</ref>
2013 - Singapore Corporate Awards Best Chief Executive Officer Award <ref>{{cite web|title=Award Winners at SCA 2013|url=http://www.scawards.com.sg/award-2013.html|website=Singapore Corporate Awards}}</ref>
==2017 presidential election== {{main|Singaporean presidential election, 2017}} On May 31, 2017, he announced his intention to run for the Presidency of Singapore, which will be reserved for Malay candidates. Mr Salleh said "I believe I have done well for myself in business and would like to step up and give back to society in a much larger way." and that he "can also fulfill the call of most Singaporeans who desire a truly independent Elected President, one who is untainted by party politics".
Salleh applied on the premise that although Second Chance Properties' shareholder equity was between $254.3 million and $263.25 million in the past three financial years, which fells short of the $500 million required for automatic qualification as a candidate, it did not prevent the Presidential Elections Committee to qualify him, if it is satisfied that he has the experience and ability to effectively carry out the functions and duties of the office of the President. Nonetheless, on 11 September 2017, the Committee rejected his application, issuing only one Certificate of Eligibility to [[Halimah Yacob]].
== Personal life == Salleh is married to Sapiyah Abu Bakar. They have four children, Radiah, Nadia, Sofia and Amal.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://sg.news.yahoo.com/family-presidential-hopeful-salleh-marican-gears-election-campaign-112444292.html|title=Family of presidential hopeful Salleh Marican gears up for election campaign|access-date=2017-08-25|language=en-SG}}</ref>

'''The Morton H. Meyerson Symphony Center''' is a concert hall located in the [[Arts District, Dallas, Texas|Arts District]] of [[Downtown Dallas|downtown]] [[Dallas, Texas|Dallas]], [[Texas]] ([[United States|USA]]). Ranked one of the world's greatest orchestra halls,<ref>http://www.dallasnews.com/sharedcontent/dws/ent/performingarts/stories/092009dngdmeyerson.1377582.html Dallas Morning News, September 20. 2009.</ref> it was designed by architect [[I.M. Pei]] and acoustician Russell Johnson's Artec Consultants, Inc. The structural engineers for this project was Leslie E. Robertson Associates, and opened in September 1989.
The Center is named for [https://2m.com/morton/ Morton H Meyerson], former president of Electronic Data Systems and former chairman and CEO of Perot Systems, who led the 10-year effort by the Dallas Symphony Association to create a home for the Dallas Symphony Orchestra. The new concert center was named in his honor in 1986 at the request of H. Ross Perot, who made a $10 million contribution to the building fund for the naming rights. It is the permanent home of the [[Dallas Symphony Orchestra]] and the [[Dallas Symphony Chorus]], as well as the primary performing venue of the [[Dallas Wind Symphony]] as well as several other Dallas-based musical organizations. The Meyerson Symphony Center is owned and managed by the City of Dallas Office of Cultural Affairs.
There are four private suites, for small concerts, meetings and events designed by Booziotis & Company Architects of Dallas - Texas.
== Design ==
The exterior of the large pavilion and lobby is circular and constructed of glass and metal supports to contrast with the solid geometric lines of the actual hall. Architect [[I. M. Pei]], and structural engineer Leslie E. Robertson Associates has described the structure of the hall's interior as "very conservative". "It is conservative for reasons I no longer accept," he said in 2000. "I feel that the hall doesn't fully represent what I would have liked to do. It was my first one."<ref>von Boehm, p. 29.</ref> Because the music performed in the hall was likely to be from the eighteenth and nineteenth centuries, Pei was unwilling to impose [[modern architecture|modern styles of architecture]] on the interior.<ref name="vb30">von Boehm, p. 30.</ref>
The trustees and acoustic team had decided on the shoebox style before Pei was hired, and he sought to sculpt the exteriors with more innovative designs. "I felt the need to be free," he said. "Therefore, to wrap another form around the shoebox, I started to use curvilinear forms.... It does have some spatial excitement in that space for that reason."<ref name="vb30"/>
===Organ=== The Meyerson Symphony Center also is home to the 4,535 pipe C.B. Fisk Opus 100 organ, known as the Lay Family Concert Organ.<ref>http://www.dallasculture.org/meyersonSymphonyCenter/aboutBuilding.asp Morton H. Meyerson Symphony Center</ref> Although it had been Charles Fisk's dream to build a monumental concert organ (the firm unsuccessfully bid on the contract for San Francisco's Davies Hall), and despite years of planning and design, he never lived to see it built, dying in 1983. The resulting instrument, built in 1991 and nearly unanimously hailed as a musical triumph, whilst it built on some of his ideas, was quite different from his original designs. The première performance was given in September 1992 by the organist [[Michael Murray (organist)|Michael Murray]]<ref>2nd September ; http://www.gothic-catalog.com/Dallas_TX_Meyerson_Symphony_Center_Fisk_organ_s/878.htm</ref> and [[David Higgs]].<ref>28th September ; DELOS 3148</ref>
=== Acoustics ===
The Eugene McDermott Concert Hall was designed by Artec Consultants (also responsible for the [[Pikes Peak Center]]'s El Pomar Great Hall). Artec’s Nicholas Edwards built upon ideas of Russell Johnson, the firm’s founder, combining them with his own research and those of the German group in Göttingen. Systematically working through each area of the hall on each level, he generated sketches that indicated the best placement for walls in order to optimize the all-important lateral reflections. As his ideas crystallized, he began calling the evolving room shape the ‘reverse fan.’ This was the eventual shape of both the Dallas concert hall and its younger sibling, Symphony Hall in Birmingham, England. Both these halls have strong ‘shoebox’ shaping, with the ‘reverse fan’ at the back of the room.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Shulman|first1=Laurie|title=Out of Place: A HyperHistory of the Elusive Acoustics of Concert Hall Venues|url=http://www.newmusicbox.org/articles/Out-of-Place-A-HyperHistory-of-the-Elusive-Acoustics-of-Concert-Hall-Venues/3/|website=NewMusicBox|publisher=New Music USA|accessdate=13 June 2017}}</ref> 74 thick concrete chamber doors around the top of the hall weighing 2.5 tons each can be opened and closed to increase or reduce reverberance, 56 acoustical curtains help diminish sound vibrations and a system of canopies weighing more than 42 tons is suspended above the stage and can be raised, lowered, or tilted to reflect the sound throughout the audience chamber.<ref>http://www.dallasculture.org/meyersonSymphonyCenter/aboutBuilding.asp Morton H. Meyerson Symphony Center. Retrieved November 30, 2009</ref> The shoebox design was intended to achieve acoustics performance comparable to that of the [[Musikverein, Vienna|Vienna Musikverein]] and the Amsterdam [[Concertgebouw]].<ref name = nyt>{{cite news |url=https://query.nytimes.com/gst/fullpage.html?res=950DE3D9163EF931A2575AC0A96F948260 |title= The Acoustics of Dallas's New Concert Hall |author = Donal Henahan, |publisher = ''[[New York Times]]'', 12 September 1989 |accessdate = August 12, 2006 | date=September 12, 1989}}</ref><ref name=ark> {{cite web |url = http://www.ark.fi/ark4_96/acoustics.html |title = Concert Hall Acoustics and the Computer |author = Tapio Lahti and Henrik Möller, |publisher = [http://www.ark.fi/index.html ARK] -''Finnish Architectural Review'', April 1996 |accessdate = August 12, 2006 |deadurl = yes |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20070322182523/http://www.ark.fi/ark4_96/acoustics.html |archivedate = March 22, 2007 |df = }}</ref> Russell Johnson, who died in August 2007, requested in his will that he be buried in the Meyerson, but logistical complications prevented the request from being granted.<ref>http://frontburner.dmagazine.com/2009/11/30/russell-johnson-sought-meyerson-burial/ "Russell Johnson Sought Meyerson Burial," D Magazine: Frontburner, November 30, 2009</ref>
=== Statistics === The Morton H. Meyerson Symphony Center has: *{{convert|260000|sqft|m2}} above ground space *{{convert|225000|sqft|m2}} below ground space *{{convert|35130|cuyd|m3}} of concrete *{{convert|30000|sqft|m2}} of Italian travertine marble *22,000 pieces of Indiana limestone *4,535 organ pipes *2,062 seats *918 square panels of African (Makore) cherrywood *216 square panels of American cherrywood *211 glass panels (no two alike) comprising the conoid windows *{{convert|85|ft|m|sing=on}} high ceiling in the concert hall *74 concrete reverberation chamber doors, each weighing as much as 2.5 tons *56 acoustical curtains *50 restrooms *4 private suites for meetings, banquets, and recitals
